title: Molly-Mae Hague and Maura Higgins dismiss feud rumours as they cosy up together on night out
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest Daily Love Island stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Love Island girls Molly-Mae and Maura showed off their unexpectedly close friendship as they enjoyed a night out together.

The influencer has put feud rumours to bed as she cosied up to the former grid girl for a photo while partying beside her.

Molly-Mae, 20, wrote: "Every blonde..." referring to the popular phrase "every blonde needs a brunette", and Maura, 28, fits exactly that description.

Posing in a smart leather dress, Molly-Mae rocks a red pout and her usual bronzed complexion as she stands left of Maura, who wears a checked blazer dress and belt.

The girls look like ultimate friendship icons as they pose side-by-side.

Kendall Rae Knight, a former Love Island contestant, commented: "Beautiessssss," and two heart eye emojis.

(Image: Aaron Parfitt / SplashNews.com)

(Image: mollymaehague/Instagram)

Their unlikely closeness comes after the drama that emerged when Maura entered the villa this summer.

The pair hardly got off to a flying start, with Maura throwing herself at Molly-Mae's beau Tommy Fury.

Now that the dust's settled, and Maura is finally official with Tommy's BFF Curtis Pritchard, the girls have become seemingly close friends.

But while they were in the villa, a theory emerged that they'd planned everything .

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

A quick hunt through their Instagram accounts showed they were in Dubai at the same time, and one holidaymaker swore she remembered seeing them having dinner together one night in a restaurant.

But Molly set the record straight to Mirror Online.

"I thought that was hilarious. Me and Maura were in Dubai at the same time, we didn't know each other, we never met," she confessed.

(Image: ITV2)

(Image: Supplied by WENN)

"But literally we were in the same restaurant at the same time and we never even knew.

"I said to her when she came into the villa, 'I really recognise you', and it was the biggest coincidence ever."

The 20-year-old added: "When I was in the villa, I was saying, 'I wonder if they'll pick up on that', because there were posts of me in Dubai.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV/REX)

"I was always wondering what the press would pick up on and they did and they were like, 'They knew each other, they planned it'.

"But I just thought what are you talking about? Like how could we do that?

(Image: Supplied by WENN)

"I didn't even tell hardly anyone I was going on Love Island, so like I'd tell a random girl in a restaurant in Dubai that I was going on.

"I just thought it was so funny, and a very, very clever conspiracy theory."
description: Molly-Mae has hinted that the girls are closer than ever with a cosy night out snap
